transaction

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • transaction.Transaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Class Transaction sends money from one user to a second one and it also display alert window to see which user sent money and which user received money.

    Class Transaction implements Observer class.

    Author:
    Erik Matoviè

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transaction(User user)
      Class constructor specifying which user is going to make a transaction.

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(User user)
        Class constructor specifying which user is going to make a transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • makeTransaction

        public void makeTransaction(User secondUser,
                            double amount)
        Make transaction from this user to second user.

        This method contains polymorphism - secondUser object of a superclass User is referencing to a subclass(UserA or UserB)

        Parameters:
        secondUser - a user to receive money
        amount - amount of money to be send
        See Also:
        User

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Displays alert window to show which user sent money and which user received money.

        This method always displays alert window to show which user sent money and which user received money.

        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - observable
        arg - a second user
        See Also:
        User
